reviews.review_text: So good. We went there for the first time tonight for dinner. My husband and I were already talking about what to order on our next visit as soon as we got into our car after the meal. There were 5 of us tonight and we had: 1. Deep fried meat dumplings - meaty fillings in crispy wrappings. 2. Seafood and green onion pancakes - it was the best Korean seafood pancake we ve had in Vancouver. The dough was light but it was filled with seafood goodness. The outside was perfectly fried with crunchy and crispy edges. 3. Beef short ribs in sweet soy sauce - The flavour of the dish rendered it as my mom s favourite. The meat was tender and charred to perfection. 4. Plain pork belly - This was my favourite. All the pieces were also charred nicely and they were heavenly with the accompanying dipping condiment (salt and spices in oil). Service was excellent. The staff were friendly and attentive. I love this place.
Great food with friendly staff. If you need service in a Korean restaurant, find the button on the table and press on it. It will alert the server. Really yummy food here.
We have been wanting to try Yook for the longest time. Last night we had an amazing time. The service as excellent and the food did not disappoint, it was awesome! Well be back for more

I visited Yook a few weeks ago and WOW, so so so so delicious. Each dish had so much flavor, the spicy pork belly was very tender and a great portion for the price. I have had seafood pancake at other restaurants and it has been uncooked or too much dough. This was the perfect green onion seafood pancake, the dough was soooo crunchy and the fillings so fresh, HUGE portion and the hot plate it comes on keeps it hot for the entire meal. I ate the leftovers cold the next day and it was great that way as well .Our server was kind and helpful , I will for sure be back 5/5!

Hidden gem! I am not sure why they are not very busy every time we come, but we usually come during lunch time only. It s authentic Korean food and price is reasonable. I used to ask for mild for spicy soup but after a while, I can handle the heat!

Been here many times. Everything is always good. Servers are attentive and would check in on us frequently and ask us if everything tasted good. Will be always one of my go-to Korean  restaurants in East Vancouver. A big plus. Their seafood green onion pancake is sooo good. Stays crispy for so long. Perfection!

Do you want home-made-style authentic K-Food experience? This is my all-time go to place for K-Food when dining out! I ve had numerous occasions with colleagues, friends, and family, and we cannot be more satisfied with every time&penny we spent at Yook! Ingredients are fresh, tasty, and mouthwatering regardless of what we ordered. Their signature grilled plates were just top-notch! Of course,  we all know well friendly K-dish  available as well. Not just the food, their staffs were always constant and friendly as well. It might be little be further from Skytrain station (Broadway/Commercial, 5-10min walking distance), but the atmosphere is clean and fresh with tons of seats for groups as well, definitely worth the visit! Highly recommended!

Been here a few times now.  I appreciate how consistently good the service is and how good the food is everytime. The Soondubu Jjigae is something I have to have everytime I am here.  The Makguksu was a life saver over the summer! The staff is great at showing how you would normally eat dishes if you have questions.  Theyre really friendly! Parking: Parking spots in front of the restaurant, to the side, and behind.  A lot of street parking available.

Im honestly not picky with Korean places, so I thought it was pretty good. I was craving cold buckwheat noodles, and their Mak-guksu didnt disappoint. It was enough to fill me up, yet light and refreshing. My partner got the Spicy Chicken on rice, which was also very good. The chicken couldve been spicier, but there were crispy bits that added good texture and flavour was on point, being one of those sweeter marinades. I honestly have no complaints and would definitely come back. Value is good for the quality of food.

My absolute favourite Korean restaurant in Vancouver  the menu is well rounded and a good value, food quality is consistent. Service is always friendly and efficient, the vibes are casual and unpretentious. My faves include their kimchi, kimchi jiggae, pancake, duk mandu guk, bibimbap, cold noodles (served year round!) I like that there s no BBQ on the tables because I hate smelling after a meal. You can still order BBQ things like LA Galbi without needing to cook it yourself. Their Galbi is delicious too obviously!!

Favourite Korean restaurant!! Everything here is always perfect. They have the absolute best seafood green onion pancake anywhere - sooo crispy and the sauce with it is unreal. The pork belly in gochujang and the beef spare ribs are amazing as well, as is the soondubu jigae. They serve an assortment of delicious side dishes with everything, the kimchi is of course our favourite.

Best Korean restaurant in the area by far! Delicious food with lots of flavors and really friendly service. Everything is off the grill, which means they cook it for you. I ordered a japchae, spicy tofu soup, pork belly and short ribs. Everything was exceeded my expectations and I certainly will be back when I m around the area. Highly recommended!

First time here and had a good experience. The kimchi soup was a bit spicy for my taste buds. The rice cake with beef and spicy pork was delicious. The spicy pork wasnt that spicy, not sure if it was because we asked the server how spicy is the pork.

Beautiful, clean interior with lots of plants. The food is delicious and prices are reasonable (under $15 for most hot pot & rice bowls). It gets crowded in the weekends so good to go earlier in the week.

If you are looking for an authentic Korean food, this is the spot! Their BBQ and soups are awesome. I took my parents to this place and they loved every single bite. Wish I live close by so I can go this place more often.
Ordered Goon Mandu - 4.5/5 Spicy Dakgalbi Bibimbap - 4.5/5 Gochujang Samgyupsal - 5/5 Everything was excellent and sumptuous. Wonderful experience.

Came here on a Monday evening.  Was not busy at all.  Friendly servers but a bit slow on refilling tea - had to ask rather than proactive service.   Pork belly was good.  Have had better seafood pancake at other places.

Great Korean food, in a local and residential neighborhood.    Food was served quickly (for a made to.l order place) and was absolutely filled with savory flavors.  Food was hot and deliciously cooked with crispy and crunchy seafood pancakes and savory rice rolls bugolgi. Service was slow, but adequate for the amount of people and table.in the location, with some.visibility issues for the servers.

Good food, higher prices then Im used to, thought the portions was good though. Japchee was $18.95 they were able to accommodate my friends dietary needs(vegetarian who also eats seafood) and made the dish with shrimp instead of beef, rice cakes with seafood was $18.95 as well and was large, I was pleasantly surprised by the size. Beef bulgogi bimbibap was good size and was $13.95. I cant wait to go back

Nice restaurant, we went there for lunch. Great service and dishes cooked really fast. Maybe at lunch hour it s not busy. The spicy pork buguri has a special deal with $3 off and tastes really good.  Generally good experience.

Found this gem the other day and we were all very amazed. We had braised short rib and spicy noodle. The braised short rib ($40ish)  is for 2-3 people and it was very tender and tasty. The place is new and everything including their washroom was super clean. The staffs were kind and they gave us 2 side dishes that were not on the menu as well. We all agreed that we will come here more often as it is a good alternative for Chosun Kalbi on Kingsway.
The gochujang samgyup bibimbap is straight up one of the best dishes Ive ever eaten anywhere. Yook is worth a trip out to the neighborhood even if you arent already in the area.

I love the ambiance of their restaurant and their dishes are just amazing. I do wish they serve more variety of side dishes but besides that, I will definitely come back to try more of their menu. We ordered makguksu, plain samgyupsal, and bulgogi. The servers are also very kind.

We have been coming back for our craving for Gamjatang ( Pork Back Bone Soup! ). It has to be one of the best in town! The soup is so hearty and rich! Goes so well with steamed rice and all the other side dishes! Service is top notch too! Street parking available!
Always excellent food. A little on the spicy side, which is what I like. I love everything!

Warning! This place is not a Korean BBQ (cook it yourself) place, instead it s al la carte. However it is SUPER DELICIOUS. We came here with a group of 6 and were completely stuffed after trying the following: 1. Gamjatang Jeongol (pork bone soup)   FIVE STARS ($29.95) 2. Haemul Pajeon (seafood pancake)   FIVE STARS ($17.95)   best I ve ever had. 3. Deung Galbi (pork back rib in sweet soy)   FOUR STARS ($24.95) 4. Spicy Dakgalbi (spicy Chicken with mozza cheese)   FIVE STARS ($25) 5. Makguksu (buckwheat noodle in spicy sauce)   FIVE STARS ($14.95) Service was very slow that night. They offered us complimentary dumplings for the wait which we appreciated the gesture. I will definitely be back for more!

Delicious food and amazing service. Waiter was so friendly and kindly refilled our side dishes, I really liked the fish cakes myself. Convenient free street parking right outside the restaurant. Can t wait to be back.

Excellent first time experience. Food was fantastic. Very fresh and authentic. Dishes were served quickly and were huge portions for the price. There were 3 different types of Bulgolgi. The appy had a bit of a sweeter sauce then the Bulgogi dish which was more savory. The dishes are definitely for sharing so order a few things and share. Each person was given a side of rice. The complimentary salad had a very nice dressing.
Delicious Korean food! Wow. We were impressed even with takeout. Can t wait to visit the restaurant
Everything taste delicious, will be back again!

Another great Korean BBQ restaurant in East of Vancouver on Nanaimo street near the North of the East Broadway street. Excellent customer services with great taste of hotpot items      love it One of the must try Korean restaurant in Eastside of Vancouver
Delicious food and great service. The spicy pork belly and pork bulgolgi were excellent. Will definitely come again next time Im nearby.
Nice Korean restaurant with great Buldak chicken, Haemul Pajeon and soft tofu soup.
Yook, neighborhood Korean restaurant. Good service good food. The gamjatang taste very good. Will recommend.
Very friendly and accommodating staff. It is very close to high traffic area and noisy outside but once you walk inside,  it feels like home.

I visit here with my Japanese friends. and All staffs were so nice and kind! foods also really huge and tasty. After visit here My friends got really good memory about Koreans and Korean food! Thank you!

Ok, this is my first time at a traditional Korean food, so I cant really judge the food. I had the simplest on the menu.  Which was fine.  Did not know what to expect.   Recognized a number of menu items from Korean dramas and stuff.    Will have try a few more dishes and perhaps invite a Korean to lunch to get a better feel. But if you are a first timer .. I would suggest that this place is an on first experience.
Awesome Korean food. Glad we found a good one close to home. Saves us the time to go downtown to have a taste of Korea.
This place has the best cold buckwheat noodle in Vancouver! Their kimchi seafood pancake was also very good.

Service was spectacular service, the woman who was serving us even did a slight jog to receive the food when the bell was rung. The food was incredible and it had a great atmosphere. I ordered the Gochuchang Samgyup Dupbap.
Tried the gochujang samgyupsal, number 16 on the menu. Very delicious. Can t wait to try it again another time.
One of the best Korean restaurants in town. Top notch meats and great tasting side dishes. Really busy place  you need reservations if you don t  want to wait long.

If you try Yook BBQs food, Im 100 percent for sure youre definitely gonna love it and want to revisit. when I miss Korean food, I come here. My favorite food is Jeyuk bokkeum! I want to recommend it to everyone. Food of this restaurant is a real taste of Korea. It reminds me of the meal my mom cooked for me. If we have not enough side dishes, they bring it for me right away. And yesterday I asked them to wrap the remaining side dishes because it was so delicious and remaining too much. but they also included some other side dishes and packed it. I cant help giving five stars to a restaurant this kind and friendly.
What can I say? The spicy pork belly (pictured) was well worth it. Good amount of kick to it. The pancake isn t anything I ve seen in any Korean restaurant before. Must eat.

Visited Yook a couple times for dinner and both visits were positive. Food came quickly, hot, and delicious. I recommend the Bibimbap with Spicy stir fry chicken, seafood pancake, and La Galbi. Their side dishes were generous and good as well.
Very tasty and authetic Korean food. Good service, too.
Solid Korean food. I had the dak (chicken) galbi with cheese. Loved the dduk pieces in there too. So good!

Group of 12 came in and we had a great meal! The food was flavorful, juicy, and just enough spice! Very clean- including the bathroom! The service was 5 stars- they greeted us with smiles every time and our ban Chan and water was always refilled!

We tried Yook for the first time and were very impressed. The staff was lovely and so helpful in choosing our meal. The Galbi Jjim for 2 was delicious and presented very well at the table. Looking forward to our next visit! Thank you so much!
The food is absolutely delicious. The staff is so swift and very polite. Some of the best japchae Ive had!
I love Yook! Sweet Soy Galbi our fav! Dine in, delivery, take out...doesnt matter...amazing!

I never been there but had delivery the other day was impressively great.  Sundubu(not sure how to spell) had the best soft tofu and a lot of kinds of seafood. They werent just spicy, they had deep flavoured broth. I will definitely have it again soon.
Great food. It may be spicy if you are not used to hot food. Try the milky beverage.

Super delicious food and great value! I usually get the bibimbap with spicy chicken, and it never disappoints, and is such a good price. The variety of vegetables is great, and they are always cooked well and the food comes fast. The chicken is never dry or tough, always moist, very delicious seasoning, and a nice belly-warming spice level. Sometimes with my takeout orders they also give me the 3 little starting appetizer plates that they give with eat in meals that include what I believe are fish cakes, marinated veggies, and one more small dish that I cant remember at the moment. I really appreciate getting these yummy extras, and they make the meal that much more special and add so much value! I always know Ill be satisfied with a meal from Yook and at a fantastic price. The service is always super friendly as well! A really great gem in Vancouver.

Today I ordered Galbi jjim and Bibimbob for two people. It was great amount and really yummy. Staffs are very friendly and kind. Good place to bring family and friends who never tried korean food before. I really enjoyed time being here. I will come back again. Thank you!!
one of the best Korean restaurants in Vancouver! the taste, the price and the service are all good. I love their playlist as well
We really enjoyed the food here. We actually ordered too much food and had to take leftovers home. Service was really good
Lovely place to eat. Great food great service! Loved it!

Love this place. Its become almost a weekly staple in our diet. The service is quick, helpful and friendly. The food is damn good and they have lots of options to choose from. We recently tried a different Korean restaurant in the area and aborted that attempt and ended up back at Took. Not sure why we bother trying somewhere else. Yook FTW!
Best Bibimbap and Bulgogi we ve had in a long time. Visiting from Toronto, we decided to do take out to our hotel. It arrived hot and the portions were sizeable. Incredible flavour. 100% recommend.

Very delicious and down to earth Korean Food. We had a spicy pork belly stir fry - it was so good and not oily at all.  There were vegetables included in this dish.  It was spicy and sweet at the same time.  And the chef maintained the texture very well.   Well balanced dish.  We also ordered the seafood soup.  They gave very generous portion of tofu.  A hearty dish.  Ambience is great.

We recently moved to the area and have been making an effort to support the local restaurants. We get take out from here quite often and its always 10/10. They have super friendly service and the food is delicious. Our go tos are either the OG Bibimbap or the Seafood Pancake. Chefs kiss!

Great family owed restaurant that has great tasting dishes. The food has a depth of flavor that tells you that they know how to cook. Smaller menu that hits all of our favorites and I look forward to taste more from this family. Modern decor that fits with food and music. Intend for this to become our local Korean food stop as we loved it. Lastly, great service from friendly staff.

Food was so yummy and tidy. I ordered pork bone soup and seafood pancake. Soup was richly tastier than other Korean restaurants . What I was really like about here was a customer SERVICE!  !   The staffs were super friendly and nice. Since it was V-day night, the restaurant was awfully busy at that time, though.
An unpretentious restaurant serving authentic Korean food at a reasonable price.

Excellent! Since my trip to Seoul, I have been on the hunt for authentic, moderately priced Korean food in Vancouver and I found it! Fairly new establishment, only open around 2 years. Hearty food with huge portions (one dish easily feeds 2) - the meats were exceptional. Perfectly marinated and grilled so you could still enjoy the juicy tenderness of the bulgogi. The kimchi was so fresh, you could still taste the crunch of the cabbage - none of that wilted, overly salty stuff here. The spicy chicken on a cast iron hot plate was the highlight. It came with chewy rice cakes, nicely caramelized by the hot pot, in a sweaty spicy sauce! Im salivating right now just thinking about it. Super yummy! The service was prompt, pleasant and speedy. Some parking available behind the restaurant. I will definitely be becoming a regular. This place is truly deserving of 5-stars.... awesome!

Yook is one of the best KBBQ places Ive been to honestly. They offer a lot of traditional Korean dishes which all taste amazing and the food is complemented by the clean and comfortable atmosphere of the restaurant. The servers were very helpful and kind and the prices for the dishes werent too bad either (between $15-35 depending on what you like and the serving size). Would definitely recommend for groups of people.

Perhaps one of the best Korean BBq Ive tried here in Vancouver. For $20 you can get a variety of different pork marinated in different sauces. I ordered the pork marinated in wine and spicy pork. The meat is tender and has good balance of fat and lean meat. The flavor is good you can taste the pork grilled with hints of red wine and spice. As standard it comes with small side dishes of salad, kimchi and rice. Friendly and welcoming staff.
The food was DELICIOUS and the decor was modern and gorgeous. It was quiet during the day when my friend and I went for lunch.

Found this place by looking at existing reviews on Google maps when looking for Korean food. I ordered the beef bulgogi and was surprised by how large the serving size was and by other side dishes included (I clearly didnt read the menu close enough) the bulgogi was delicious and was definitely what I was looking for. The sides complimented the dish too. The restaurant wasnt empty yet I received my order quickly. Will definitely be coming back.

Turn around time from order to receiving your meal is very quick! Staff is very warm a friendly, portion sizes are large (great for left overs), and taste amazing! Great for bringing a group, as there are lots of dishes best shared.

One of my favorite Korean places in the neighborhood. I love their rice cakes and always always order it! Their spice levels are on point and everything is reasonably priced. Good customers service as well!

As one of our local neighbour hood restaurants, this place is one of my favourites in Vancouver. The food is always on point and fairly priced for the amount you get especially if you are sharing with others. The service, music, and atmosphere is great. My only complaint is they need some more variety with their beer and shouldn t charge so much for it. They raised the price of a small can of P49 Lager to $8! We got take-out the other day due to covid and bought some beer next door. What a difference to have an actual tasty beer with some spicy dakgalbi. Regardless, I m looking forward to being able to sit down at Yook again to enjoy some delicious eats.
Ive only ordered via Uber Eats and quality has been consistently good. They dont seem to mark up their prices on the app either which is a huge plus.

Delicious food, and the kitchen was really quick to get our food out despite the restaurant being very busy, and the serving staff was friendly and knowledgeable and has reliable recommendations for us. A new favourite!
The waitresses were awesome and the food delicious. Beef noodles didnt have much beef (almost none) but Ill definitely be back

Great food with nice appeal. Very polite staff who provide great service throughout the entire meal.  Clean outside the restaurant through to the inside of the restaurant as well as a clean washroom. 5 stars and highly recommend it. It shows they take great care of the appearance and know how to cook great food.

My wife and I come here quite often, we really enjoy the food and service here. If we are craving some authentic Korean food we like to come here and my wife is korean. She says its one of the better places she has gone to in vancouver and because it is close to home makes it so much better. The food is really yummy and like the side dishes here. It is pretty well priced for Korean food in vancouver. Wish it closed a bit later though as my friends and I like to go for late meals and few drinks sometimes. The workers here are pleasant and welcoming. I also recommend this place to my friends and colleagues when they ask me where do I go for some good Korean food. I totally recommend people to come here and give it a try!

Nice little place. Really friendly staff and awesome food! Very reasonably priced for the amount and quality of food you get. We ordered seafood pancake and fried dumplings to start. For mains we had pork belly and beef bulgogi. We had leftovers and had to take half the pancake and some bulgogi home. Would recommend if you are in the area.

Decor is lovely and chic. Place looked very clean on the inside and staff was polite. Complimentary side dishes were delicious. The food was beyond my expectations! I highly recommend the japchae and bulgolgi bibimbap. Their meats are very flavourful and tender. Portions are bigger than most korean restaurants. Overall, it is a bit pricey but well worth it. Paid street parking is available outside.
Great service and great food at reasonable prices. I am definitely going to come back again.
Good place with delicious food plus friendly staff and quick service time.

I am Korean and this place absolutely make good quality of Korean food. I ordered  makguksu which is a cold noodle and bibimbap through the delivery today. Both were so good and I think Makguksu was the best in Vancouver.
Nice atmosphere, nice service, amazing food, will be back

Tried different Korean places all over the city. This place is our new fave! Amazing, fast service. The main dishes, appetizers and side dish condiments were SO yummy and fresh! We will be back again!

One of the best Korean restaurant in Vancouver. I tried their cold noodle and soy sauce pork belly bbq, and both were fantastic.  I read other reviews and people shouldnt complain about bibimbab not served in hot stone bowl. Bibimbab and Hot stone Bibimbab are two different menus in Korea.
Came for a quick dinner and everything was delicious.  The JapChae is probably one of the best Ive ever had in Vancouver. Cant wait to go back!
The greatest Korean bbq experience of all time. No smoke no mess since they marinate and make the meat + side dishes in house. Great for families and fastest takeout service ever

Their service is excellent! I was in rush but need to have a quick lunch. I dont have time to BBQ the meat by myself and the server said they can cook the meat for me. Service is very humanize. Food is good too.
Best makgooksoo(cold noodle) place in town!

This place is excellent! The first time I ate here everyone at the table loved what they had and the staff is super friendly. I ve been back several times and I ve been happy every time. The kimchi stew amazing!
Really delicious food, best Ive had since Korea. Service was nice. Ambience is only so so with horrible music turned quite loud even for lunch, but I guess thats authentic!
Their bibimbaps are a bomb   so good. My partner and I love the spicy pork one.
theres some extra stars.foods great. Authentic. Portions good. And the service! Typical Korean service =
Food was really good, great depth of flavour and with enough heat to remind you that you were there for the next couple of hours.
So good. The seafood and green onion pancake was out of this world. Gochujang pork belly was also so good and I dont even eat pork.
I dont have a huge experience with Korean food but this place was fantastic! Delicious pork belly, nice atmosphere and kind wait staff. Going back tomorrow!
Visited a few weeks ago, #12 Marinated pork belly on rice is a great selection if your looking for a bit of spice
Amazing food. Hardworking staff. Pork kimchi soup and mae-mil spicy cold noodle is unmatched in Vancouver. I would literally come here just for the mae-mil noodle and I live in Langley.

Came here for lunch today and was pleasantly surprised! Its a great little spot with amazing food with quick and efficient service. Prices are very reasonable and theres lots of free parking all around. Recommended!
